abstract: A Silicon Valley maker of solar power arrays that was started with high hopes and $527 million in loans from the federal government said that it would cease operations.
snippet: A Silicon Valley maker of solar power arrays that was started with high hopes and $527 million in loans from the federal government said that it would cease operations.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON —  A Silicon Valley maker of solar power arrays that was started with high hopes and $527 million in loans from the federal government said on Wednesday that it would cease operations. The failure of the company — and the loss to taxpayers — is likely to renew the debate in Washington about the wisdom of clean energy subsidies and loan guarantees.

headline.main: Solar Firm Aided by Federal Loans Shuts Doors
headline.print_headline: Solar Firm Aided by U.S. Shuts Doors

abstract: Environmentalists released a report documenting what they said was pollution from “suspected” Apple suppliers throughout China.
snippet: Environmentalists released a report documenting what they said was pollution from “suspected” Apple suppliers throughout China.
lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — A Chinese environmental group has singled out Apple for criticism, accusing the company’s Chinese suppliers of discharging polluted waste and toxic metals into surrounding communities and threatening public health.

headline.main: Apple Cited as Adding to Pollution in China
headline.print_headline: Apple Cited As Adding To Pollution In China
